item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, February 8, 2025 at 9:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. No-Libc Zig Now Outperforms Glibc Zig (58 points | 32 comments)
2. Three Years of Ephemeral NixOS: My Experience Resetting Root on Every Boot (18 points | 8 comments)
3. Carbon is not a programming language (sort of) (13 points | 3 comments)
4. Synctrain: a rethought iOS client for Syncthing (8 points | 4 comments)
5. Gleam v1.8.0 released (69 points | 14 comments)
6. AI haters build tarpits to trap and trick AI scrapers that ignore robots.txt (21 points | 11 comments)
7. getaddrinfo sucks. everything else is much worse (28 points | 14 comments)
8. AI exploits a gamebreaking bug in Trackmania (3 points | no comments)
9. Consuming the jetstream atproto firehose correctly (1 points | no comments)
10. CPython tail-call interpreter merged for Python 3.14, a 10% speedup in benchmarks (43 points | 18 comments)
11. We are destroying software (12 points | 13 comments)
12. Lume, an MIT-licensed CLI to virtualize macOS environments (7 points | 1 comment)
13. Erika 10 (2 points | no comments)
14. The case for sans-io (3 points | 5 comments)
15. Refined: simple refinement types for Rust (13 points | 9 comments)
16. Docker Bake is Now Generally Available (9 points | 2 comments)
17. Fun Friday: what's the weirdest automation you've ever made? (15 points | 39 comments)
18. Trivalent: A hardened chromium for desktop Linux inspired by Vanadium (3 points | 1 comment)
19. Be Skeptical of All Code - Not Just the Funny Stuff (1 points | no comments)
20. You Didn't Notice MP3 Is Now Free (54 points | 41 comments)
21. A tale of several distros joining forces for a common goal: reproducible builds (3 points | no comments)
22. Comments on Shared Unix Hosting vs. the Cloud (30 points | 61 comments)
23. Cloudflare incident on February 6, 2025 (19 points | 1 comment)
24. polysubml-demo: A simple ML-like language with subtyping, polymorphism, higher rank types, and global type inference (13 points | 2 comments)
25. numbat: A statically typed programming language for scientific computations with first class support for physical dimensions and units (18 points | 10 comments)
